body_html:
@gunan fixed the variables as suggested. Cleaned out the logic even more:

tensorflow_ENABLE_MKL_SUPPORT and openmp was dependent on tensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS. I mean yeah you should probably have both but the logic doesn't exactly make sense. Also, there were two separate MKL blocks.

Now just several separate if statements:

  • if MKL support
  • if openmp gcc
  • if openmp vc
  • if win simd

I combined the 2 MKL blocks as well

body:
@gunan fixed the variables as suggested. Cleaned out the logic even more:

tensorflow_ENABLE_MKL_SUPPORT and openmp was dependent on tensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS. I mean yeah you should probably have both but the logic doesn't exactly make sense. Also, there were two separate MKL blocks.

Now just several separate if statements:
- if MKL support
- if openmp gcc
- if openmp vc
- if win simd

I combined the 2 MKL blocks as well
